Posts.Title: Blasted steroids

Posts.Content: Hi Linz1230 I'm on a similar treatment to you - fec x 3 then t x 3 and I'm four days away from my second fec.  I know exactly what you mean about feeling bad being so reliant on other people but just go with it.. you need to get your strength back and listen to your body.  I have been feeling really good for the last week (2nd week) but today I feel rubbish, look rubbish (so pale and tired) and to cap it all my hair is falling out !  Fortunately my hubby is being a rock and my teenage sons are being lovely and looking after me, but it's still hard to accept what's happening... Jo
Posts.Title: Chemo advice please

Posts.Content: Hi Nicky I was really interested to read your comments, I am FEC 1 day 17 so building myself up for 2nd chemo this Friday and having felt fine for a week I'm now having a low energy day which has rather taken me by surprise.  Also I look as pale as I did for the first few days after chemo 1 too, so I'm having a very quiet restful day and catching up on this forum. I loved your description of how you felt days 1-3 - exactly how I felt last time too!  Hard to describe to others isn't it!  You said you have a yoga for breast cancer DVD - can I ask where you got it or who is it by please? I completely understand how you feel about the hair/wig/scarf thing!  Yesterday my hair started to fall out and today we (hubby and I) are going to cut it off, really really short to start with and then maybe shave... But I'm looking at my diary for next few days and thinking oh no how am I going to cope with going out and meeting friends and family, neighbours, strangers...  Collect my wig on Wednesday and I've practised with scarves but all the same .. it's a very big step! Have courage Smoothie and keep smiling!    (by the way this is the first time I've replied to someone so hope this was the right way to do it?!) Jo
